title: Victory and the Festival of Purim
summary: On the appointed day, the Jews successfully defend themselves. Hamanâ€™s ten sons are executed. Mordecai establishes the festival of Purim to celebrate their deliverance. It becomes an annual celebration of joy and remembrance.

faq.question: What is Purim?
faq.answer: A Jewish festival commemorating their deliverance from destruction, named after the lots (pur) Haman cast.

faq.question: How did the Jews respond to their victory?
faq.answer: With feasting, celebration, and giving gifts to one another and the poor.
